isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 7600 DAY CAB and extended cab model with rear pto and some engine options AND 7700 DAY CAB MODEL AFTER MARCH 2005

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 7600 DAY CAB and extended cab model with rear pto and some engine options AND 7700 DAY CAB MODEL AFTER MARCH 2005

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 7600 day cab and extended cab model with rear PTO and some engine options and 7700 day cab model after March 2005 contains one air spring (bag) (Item 4), two shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 7). The air suspension assembly (Figure 141) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 12), elbow fitting (Item 11), elbow fitting (Item 30), elbow fitting (Item 31), air spring (bag) (Item 4), height control valve (Item 7), shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) and lateral control rod (Item 3) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 7), air spring (bag) (Item 4) and shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 141) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 7, Figure 141) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 142 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Inspect height control valve (Item 4) to insure drive bearing notch (Item 15) on rear side of drive bearing (Item 14) is located on "SUPPLY" port side of valve. If not, loosen pan head bearing screw (Item 13), but not remove, and pull height control valve arm (Item 11) loose from drive bearing (Item 14). Rotate drive bearing until drive bearing notch is in correct position, then secure height control valve lever by tightening pan head bearing screw. Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-in (4.5 to 5.6 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 7) on mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).

Install two hex head bolts (Item 13) thru height control valve and mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex lock nuts (Item 14). Tighten hex head bolts and hex lock nuts to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (10.8 to 13.8 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 142 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Push air line (supply) (Item 3) into release collet (Item 1) of elbow fitting (Item 2) in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 4) until it bottoms, push air line in again to make sure air line is inserted past collet and O-ring then pull on air line to check engagement of release collet.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 6) into compression nut (Item 5) of elbow fitting (Item 7) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 4). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.

Install height control valve linkage (Item 8) onto threaded ball pivot (Item 9) of height control valve arm (Item 11) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place, latch the linkage clip (Item 10).
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate of cab air suspension system (Figure 223) . Cab air suspension air spring (bag) design height is 6.98 inches (177.3 mm). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
Cab Air Suspension for 7600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Model with Rear PTO and some Engine Options and 7700 Day Cab Model after March 2005
.

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install driver side shock absorber (Item 5) as follows.

step2.para: Position threaded shaft of driver side shock absorber (Item 5) with bushing retainer and rubber bushing (Items 20 and 21) in place through driver side frame mounting bracket (Item 33 or 34).

Install rubber bushing and bushing retainer (Items 21 and 20) over threaded shaft of driver side shock absorber (Item 5) and install hex lock nut (Item 19). Tighten hex lock nut (Item 19) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Position top of driver side shock absorber (Item 5) in place in shock mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install hex head bolt (Item 17) from the rear and install hex lock nut (Item 18). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 17 and 18) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

step1.para: Install passenger side shock absorber (Item 6) as follows.

step2.para: Position threaded shaft of passenger side shock absorber (Item 6) with bushing retainer and rubber bushing (Items 20 and 21) in place through passenger side frame mounting bracket (Item 33 or 34).

Install rubber bushing and bushing retainer (Items 21 and 20) over threaded shaft of passenger side shock absorber (Item 6) and install hex lock nut (Item 19). Tighten hex lock nut (Item 19) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Position top of passenger side shock absorber (Item 6) in place in shock mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install hex head bolt (Item 17) from the rear and install hex lock nut (Item 18). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 17 and 18) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position air spring (bag) (Item 4) between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and secure as follows.

note.para: A new retaining ring (Item 28) is supplied with the new air spring (Bag).

step2.para: Position top of air spring (bag) (Item 4) over threaded stud (Item 24) of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and thread air spring (bag) up until it contacts cab mounting plate. Tighten to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (10.8 to 13.6 N•m).
Position stud on bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4) into hole in crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Install new retaining ring (Item 28) over stud on bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4) and securely press on stud.
Apply pipe thread sealant to threads of elbow fitting (Item 11) and reinstall into bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4). Tighten hand tight plus 270 to 450 degrees.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 12) into compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 11) at bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

step1.para: Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate of cab air suspension system (Figure 223) . Cab air suspension air spring (bag) design height is 6.98 inches (177.3 mm). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
Cab Air Suspension for 7600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Model with Rear PTO and some Engine Options and 7700 Day Cab Model after March 2005
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod (Item 3) as follows.

step2.para: Position lateral control rod (Item 3) in lateral control rod mount (Item 25) of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and install hex head bolt (Item 22) from the front thru lateral control rod mount and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 23). Tighten to 70 to 90 Lbf-ft (94.9 to 122 N•m).

Position lateral control rod (Item 3) in mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex head bolt (Item 22) from the front thru mounting bracket of cab mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 23). Tighten to 70 to 90 Lbf-ft (94.9 to 122 N•m).

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

svcsubproc.title: Install Jounce Bumper
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position jounce bumper (Item 10) underneath cab mounting plate (Item 1).

Install hex head bolt (Item 15) thru jounce bumper (Item 10) and cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex lock nut (Item 16) thru access hole in cab mounting plate . Tighten to 2 to 4 Lbf-ft (3 to 5 N•m).
